name: Brando Movies Quiz | Marlon Brando | 10 Questions

questions.text: In 'The Young Lions', what role did Brando play?
questions.explanation:
German Soldier.

	Dean Martin and Montgomery Clift were U.S. soldiers in this movie version of the Irwin Shaw novel.

questions.text: Brando played in 'Sayonara', but one of his fellow actors got top reviews for his work in the movie.
Brando occasionally made a western. Which of these is one of his?
questions.explanation:
One-Eyed Jacks.

	'Smith' is {McQueen;} 'Gun' is Newman. 'Wild Bunch' has many people in it - but no Brando.

questions.text: Brando did a re-make of 'Mutiny on the Bounty'. He played the Clark Gable role of Fletcher Christian; who played the Charles Laughton role of Captain Bligh?
questions.explanation:
Trevor Howard.

	It's hard to improve on a classic.

questions.text: Brando also did musicals. Who was his leading lady in 'Guys and Dolls'?
Who played Brando's romantic rival for Shirley Jones in the comedy, 'Bedtime Story'?
One of the great movie lines comes when Brando complains in 'On The Waterfront' that he 'could have been a contender'. To whom is he speaking?
questions.explanation:
Rod Steiger.

	The others are in the movie, but he says it to Steiger.

questions.text: Some of his movies didn't do that well: consider 'Reflections in a Golden Eye'. Who was his co-star?
Brando played in the movie version of the Broadway play, 'Teahouse of the August Moon'. Who was his co-star?
questions.explanation:
Glenn Ford.

	He plays an Oriental.

questions.text: Brando's best known performance may be as Stanley Kowalski in 'Streetcar Named Desire'. Vivien Leigh played Blanche, but Brando is remembered for yelling 'hey, Stella'. Who played Stella?
questions.explanation:
Kim Hunter.

	If you like that sort of thing.
